info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 14 at 1:39PM PDT until August 16 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HOT...DRY...WINDY...AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS TODAY FOLLOWED BY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... .A very hot and dry air mass will produce low afternoon humidities, and when combined with afternoon and evening winds, critical fire weather conditions are expected for valleys west of the Cascades. Dry and unstable conditions could lead to rapid fire growth at the Flat Fire or any other active fires in the area. Additionally, monsoonal/tropical moisture will bring isolated to scattered thunderstorms through week. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 280, 281, 284, AND 621... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop have a high probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREA...In California...portions of Fire weather zones 280...281...and 284. In Oregon...the eastern portions of Fire weather zone 621. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated thunderstorms are expected Tuesday. Scattered thunderstorms will be possible over a broader area on Wednesday. Storms will be a hybrid of wet/dry on Tuesday and trend wetter on Wednesday, but lightning strikes outside of the wet cores are still likely. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts 30 to 40 mph. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Plan now to avoid using equipment that could cause sparks during the period when critical weather conditions are possible. Visit weather.gov/medford/wildfire for links to fire restrictions in your area. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning.
